thread.title: Propeller hits pilot on the head
thread.title_full: Propeller hits pilot on the head

author: Staff Reporter
title: Propeller hits pilot on the head
text:
Propeller hits pilot on the head Article By: Staff Reporter Mon, 21 Sep 2015 5:07 PM Share A file image of a propeller. Credit: pixabay.com 
A young pilot sustained serious injuries when a plane propeller hit him on the head. 
The incident occurred at the Jean-Lesage Airport in Quebec City in Canada on Saturday afternoon, CBC News reported. 
The man, in his twenties, has a private pilot license and over 150 hours of training. 
He was a passenger on a small plane which landed on the grounds of the Orizon Aviation Qu√©bec school. 
After leaving the plane, he walked too close to the propeller, which was still moving. It hit him on the head, seriously injuring him. 
He was transported to hospital after the accident. 
Airport spokesperson Mathieu Claise said that the young pilot should have known not to leave the plane before the propeller was at a complete stop, CBC reported. 
He said he cannot explain why the pilot walked in front of the plane. 
Aviation officials are investigating the incident. Related Articles
